articles.author: JON GAMBRELL, ADAM SCHRECK and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israel attacked military targets in Iran with a series of pre-dawn airstrikes Saturday in retaliation for the barrage of ballistic missiles the Islamic Republic fired upon Israel earlier in the month.
articles.title: Israel attacks Iran in series of pre-dawn airstrikes targeting military infrastructure

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE, COLLEEN LONG and NADIA LATHAN
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Kamala Harris and Beyoncé ignited a Houston rally with a double-barreled argument against Donald Trump on Friday, with the superstar telling the Democratic nominee’s biggest crowd ever that it was “time to sing a new song” as Harris warned that her GOP opponent was dead set on further eroding women’s rights.
articles.title: Harris and Beyoncé ignite a Houston rally with a double-barreled argument against Trump

articles.author: JILL COLVIN, JONATHAN J. COOPER and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich. (AP) — Many of Donald Trump’s supporters left a Michigan rally before he arrived after the former president kept them waiting for three hours to tape a popular podcast interview.
articles.title: Trump leaves Michigan rallygoers waiting in the cold for hours to tape Joe Rogan podcast

articles.author: MELISSA GOLDIN, MIKE CATALINI and ALI SWENSON
articles.description: YARDLEY, Pa. (AP) — Russian actors were behind a widely circulated video falsely depicting mail-in ballots for Donald Trump being destroyed in Pennsylvania, U.S.
articles.title: Russian actors made fake video depicting mail-in ballots for Trump being destroyed, FBI says

articles.author: PHILIP MARCELO
articles.description: CENTRAL ISLIP, N.Y. (AP) — The former longtime CEO of Abercrombie & Fitch pleaded not guilty Friday to federal sex trafficking and interstate prostitution charges.
articles.title: Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO pleads not guilty to sex trafficking and prostitution charges

articles.author: TED ANTHONY
articles.description: Less than two weeks before Election Day, The Washington Post said Friday it would not endorse a candidate for president in this year's tightly contested race and would avoid doing so in the future — a decision immediately condemned by a former executive editor but one that the current publisher insisted was “consistent with the values the Post has always stood for.”
articles.title: Washington Post becomes second major US newspaper this week to not endorse a presidential candidate

articles.author: JOHN ROGERS
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Phil Lesh, a classically trained violinist and jazz trumpeter who found his true calling reinventing the role of rock bass guitar as a founding member of the Grateful Dead, died Friday at age 84.
articles.title: Phil Lesh, founding member of Grateful Dead and influential bassist, dies at 84

articles.author: JONEL ALECCIA
articles.description: A deadly outbreak of E. coli poisoning tied to McDonald's Quarter Pounders has expanded, with at least 75 people sick in 13 states, federal health officials said Friday.
articles.title: At least 75 people are sickened as the deadly McDonald's E. coli outbreak expands

articles.author: BETH HARRIS
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A nail-biter all night with a Hollywood ending. Game 1 of Yankees-Dodgers certainly delivered.Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history with two outs in the 10th inning to give the Los Angeles Dodgers a 6-3 victory over the New York Yankees in a drama-filled opener Friday.
articles.title: Freeman hits 1st walk-off slam in World Series history as Dodgers top Yankees 6-3 in classic opener

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — A NASA astronaut was taken to the hospital for an undisclosed medical issue after returning from a nearly eight-month space station stay extended by Boeing's capsule trouble and Hurricane Milton, the space agency said Friday.
articles.title: NASA astronaut remains in the hospital after returning from an extended stay in space
